snippet.textDisplay:
Man, I can't wait!! Having played every FF since FF1, even obscure, almost impossible to find FFs with google, and some not even credited as a FF even though they have the Final Fantasy moniker, such as Final Fantasy Ehrgeiz which was a hack and slash level based game you craqlwed down floors on, upgrading your characters by what types of things they ate/gear, etc, etc.... FFVII is the game that set the standard for all RPGs since it's release, changing them from cult-like just grinding with mediocre stories into games with characters being what makes a good one stand out,


The scene when Sephiroth descends on Aeris, killing her, was the single most influential scene in any RPG, and still is to a lot of people. It caused an entirely new aspect of what RPGs would become.


Now, it's been 30 years of FF, with no signs of stopping, only getting better and better, I just cant wait!!


Ehgeiz is almost impossible to find, I have 2 copies, but can't even locate it with google, on Ebay, etc, etc. It's not even on the official list of the 47 games with the FF moniker. There are others like that too. (since so many don't know about it, or believe there is such a game. And I don't mean Ehrgeiz: God Bless The Ring, it's actually named Final Fantasy Ehrgeiz, and none of the FF characters are in it)
snippet.textOriginal:
Man, I can't wait!! Having played every FF since FF1, even obscure, almost impossible to find FFs with google, and some not even credited as a FF even though they have the Final Fantasy moniker, such as Final Fantasy Ehrgeiz which  was a hack and slash level based game you craqlwed down floors on, upgrading your characters by what types of things they ate/gear, etc, etc.... FFVII is the game that set the standard for all RPGs since it's release, changing them from cult-like just grinding with mediocre stories into games with characters being what  makes a good one stand out,


The scene when Sephiroth descends on Aeris, killing her, was the single most influential scene in any RPG, and still is to a lot of people. It caused an entirely new aspect of what RPGs would become. 


Now,  it's been 30 years of FF, with no signs of stopping, only getting better and better, I just cant wait!!


Ehgeiz is almost impossible to find, I have 2 copies, but can't even locate it with google, on Ebay, etc, etc. It's not even on the official list of the 47 games with the FF moniker. There are others like that too. (since so many don't know about it, or believe there is such a game. And I don't mean Ehrgeiz: God Bless The Ring, it's actually named Final Fantasy Ehrgeiz, and none of the FF characters are in it)

snippet.textDisplay: I have a feeling that the game(s) will take place in fewer locations to skip over the world map exploration aspect. So far we haven't seen how you'll travel location to location (SE always does this to their detriment withholding things). A lot of story, if not half is taking place in Midgard to cut back on. I just have a feeling SE is doing a bit of false marketing on this "more content" and not mentioning what isn't there. It likely will only come out when the second part releases where they will actually have to travel outside Midgard. That may tell the tale. In the meantime, I'm expecting the same level of "content" FF XV had; up to the gamer how fun non-connected quests for the most part will be.
snippet.textOriginal: I have a feeling that the game(s) will take place in fewer locations to skip over the world map exploration aspect. So far we haven't seen how you'll travel location to location (SE always does this to their detriment withholding things). A lot of story, if not half is taking place in Midgard to cut back on. I just have a feeling SE is doing a bit of false marketing on this "more content" and not mentioning what isn't there. It likely will only come out when the second part releases where they will actually have to travel outside Midgard. That may tell the tale. In the meantime, I'm expecting the same level of "content" FF XV had; up to the gamer how fun non-connected quests for the most part will be.

snippet.textDisplay: I promised myself 14 years ago I wouldn’t buy another video game console because I was addicted to playing games. Years ago when the remake was announced, I then said, “buying a console when this game comes out!!!” It’s been a long time coming. Thanks to all the creators who have worked long and hard on this game!
snippet.textOriginal: I promised myself 14 years ago I wouldn’t buy another video game console because I was addicted to playing games. Years ago when the remake was announced, I then said, “buying a console when this game comes out!!!” It’s been a long time coming. Thanks to all the creators who have worked long and hard on this game!

snippet.textDisplay: I don't mind text bubbles being replaced with cutscenes but the battle system should be better than Kingdom Hearts or FF15. I would at least hope they thought about how comprehensive the FF7 battle system is and work as much of it into the new game as possible. I don't want an action RPG where I'm just spamming the X button on all the enemies and not much more to battles than that.
snippet.textOriginal: I don't mind text bubbles being replaced with cutscenes but the battle system should be better than Kingdom Hearts or FF15. I would at least hope they thought about how comprehensive the FF7 battle system is and work as much of it into the new game as possible. I don't want an action RPG where I'm just spamming the X button on all the enemies and not much more to battles than that.

snippet.textDisplay: I grew up playing Final Fantasy and I can say it is by far my favorite game. I have a lot of memories playing it, especially when I only wanted to do the Chocobo races and not actual game itself. Overall, I’m so excited to see how this all comes together!
